Planned Parenthood To Launch Ad Campaign …








Planned Parenthood To Launch Ad Campaign Against Florida Abortion Ban

Contact:
Damien Filer /  [email protected]


For Immediate Release:
Jan. 25, 2022


Share This



Twitter







Facebook







Tumblr








TALLAHASSEE – Tomorrow the Florida Alliance of Planned Parenthood Affiliates (FAPPA) will launch a multi-pronged paid advertising campaign pushing back against the proposed 15-week abortion ban (HB 5/SB 146) currently moving through the Florida Legislature. The campaign will incorporate digital, print and mobile billboard advertising. The mobile billboard will spend Wednesday and Thursday driving past the Capitol, Governor's Mansion, Florida Supreme Court, Florida A&M University and Florida State University.
Digital ads will be run over the coming days on Facebook and Politico websites, with print ads set to appear tomorrow in the Tallahassee Democrat, Miami Herald and Naples Daily News.
“Every Floridian deserves the freedom to make their own decisions about their bodies and their lives — including the decision to have an abortion,” said Laura Goodhue, Executive Director of the Florida Alliance of Planned Parenthood Affiliates. “The politicians who oppose our right to abortion are trying to take away that freedom, and we refuse to stand by.”
What: Launch of multifaceted $66,000+ ad campaign against 15-week abortion ban (HB 5/SB 146) in Florida; examples of billboard ads below.
When: Wednesday January 26, 2022
Who: Florida Alliance of Planned Parenthood Affiliates
Where: Tallahassee, Miami, Naples, online
###




















This page is controlled and operated by Florida Alliance of Planned Parenthood Affiliates, Inc..













The Planned Parenthood Action Fund works to advance access to sexual health care and defend reproductive rights.
